ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I did my thesis and finished my major.
I learned more about the process of research and publication in my field.
Skills to be an effective researcher.

I learned how to answer scientific questions I posed with data that I collected. Importantly, I also learned how to deal with the difficult logistics and bumps in the road that are inherent to research.

How to work on a larger project- pacing, troubleshooting, writing, coding - hindsight is 20-20 because there are a lot of things I would have done differently. With lab research, I think starting as early as possible is key to a successful project, thinking VERY thoroughly through all of the questions you want to ask/answer and the broadest range of data you can collect so that you have as many options at the end to write a compelling narrative about your subject.
I got a lot of research experience with lab work, computing, research, and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a great chance to conduct independent research and explore your own interests. However, there is no departmental support whatsoever (you are effectively signing up to get credit, not taking a research class), so you will be depending on your lab to teach you how to plan and execute your research and how to write your thesis.

Everyone's research experience will be very different. One of the greatest strengths of my experience was the independence I was afforded. While my advisor was invaluable to creating the foundations of my project, at the end of the semester, I could look back at my work and say that I had accomplished something. The biggest weakness was that I feel like I didn't receive as much feedback as I wanted, but that is to be expected from a busy advisor.
Weaknesses: Could use more deadlines/benchmarks/guidance because as it is right now, the pacing is entirely self determined. It really really depends on your PI

I appreciated the flexibility of the course, and that there werent many intermediate deadlines so I could pace myself in a way that made sense for me. I think that the expectations and final deadline could have been communicated a little more clearly.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you need to write a thesis, I'd recommend it.
Sure, if you're an E&EB major.
I would recommend this course to any student who is interested in a possible career in scientific academia.
Most certainly. It's a great way to find out if research is for you. Also, the opportunity to answer a question that you are truly interested in is invaluable.
Yes, I really enjoyed my experience doing research!
